alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued October 12 at 4:10PM AKDT until October 13 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT THURSDAY FOR THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Visibility reduced to 1/4 mile or less. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 18 inches. Northeast winds 35 to 50 mph gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...Until 1 AM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The worst conditions are occurring now and are expected to continue through around to just after midnight. While the snow is expected to diminish in intensity after midnight, gusty winds are expected through Thursday morning which may blow and resuspend the already fallen snow. Expect gradually improving conditions during the day Thursday as winds diminish.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
